title: Configure external access port
content:
Service Management supports configuring user-defined external access port. Changing the external access port updates the service configuration; however, dependent pods may still reference the previous port settings. Restarting these pods ensures they correctly apply the updated configuration and function as expected.

Restart required after port change. Restarting will cause system downtime, as services will be temporarily unavailable during the process.

To configure the external access port, perform the following steps:

  1. Update the external access port in values.yaml with the desired port number. 
    global:
    externalAccessPort: <port number>
  2. Perform helm upgrade. 
    helm upgrade <release name> <ESM helm chart path> -n <suite namespace> -f my-values.yaml
  3. Restart the pods.  
    ./cdfctl.sh runlevel set -l DOWN -n <suite namespace>

./cdfctl.sh runlevel set -l UP -n <suite namespace>
